title: The twists and turns of Trump's military strategy
subhed: Venezuela, Greenland, Iran... Behind Donald Trump's martial rhetoric, Washington has forged a strategy of targeted strikes and simultaneous operations, running the risk of stretching its military capabilities too thin.
byline: By Chloé Hoorman and Elise Vincent

title: Emmanuel Macron issues stern warning to French defense industry
Vladimir Putin has stayed silent and powerless on Iran, despite their 'strategic partnership'
Trump announces Gaza 'board of peace' as phase two of US-backed plan begins
subhed: The ceasefire has seen continued Israeli attacks on the war-ravaged strip, with key questions remaining over withdrawal and disarmament.

title: Germany is questioning the future of the European project
subhed: Berlin is expressing doubt about the European Union's ability to withstand the rise of nationalist parties and the pressure from the Trump administration. This unprecedented skepticism in Germany has raised fears of lasting weakening, or even the gradual marginalization, of Europe as it exists today.

title: Benedictine nuns of Montmartre 'under duress' for 40 years, report finds
subhed: An independent investigation, commissioned by the congregation, reveals that Mother Marie-Agnès, the congregational prioress general, ruled through an atmosphere of 'terror and suspicion.' The control of food and of women's weight was central to the superior's domination.

title: 'India and Europe are discovering new geostrategic affinities, an example of realignment amid global chaos'
subhed: The warming of relations between Europe and the world's most populous country reflects a counter-strategy to the hostility of the Trump administration, writes Le Monde's columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Moldovan president backs unification with Romania
US sanctions Iranian officials over crackdown on protests
Macron's party endorses Sarkozy's son in Riviera election, dividing members
Denmark and Greenland hit Trump administration's intransigence
How Gianni Infantino's pay quadrupled in 10 years as head of FIFA
French Olympic champion Yannick Agnel to stand trial on rape charges
Behind France's declining birthrate, the complex question of wanting children
Uganda's veteran guerrilla, Yoweri Museveni, seeks a seventh term
Trump threatens to invoke Insurrection Act in Minnesota
Macron says France to send more forces to Greenland
Greenlanders overwhelmed by Trump's ambitions: '$10,000 to annex the island, who does he think we are?'
byline: By Isabelle Mandraud (Nuuk, Greenland, special correspondent)

title: 'In the face of Trump's imperialism, realism means defending the law as an indispensable tool'
After celebrating Maduro ouster, Venezuelan migrants in US fear what lies ahead
subhed: After celebrating the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, Venezuelan asylum seekers in the US have begun to have doubts. In Denver, Colorado, where they number in the tens of thousands, many now fear having to go back to their country with the Chavistas still in power.

title: 'The Islamic Republic of Iran is entering its final phase'
subhed: Hemmed in by domestic and external crises, the Islamic Republic of Iran is now finding itself with nowhere left to turn, analyzes Farid Vahid, the co-director of the Observatory of North Africa and the Middle East at the Fondation Jean Jaurès.

title: How France's fixation with decline serves the Trumpian narrative
subhed: As the threat posed by the United States grows, narratives of decline have gained traction in France, setting the stage for a presidential campaign centered on the power of France and Europe.

title: President Trump, Greenland does not want to become American
'The raw and brutal display of American power in the Trump II era is finally opening the eyes of Washington's allies'
'Instead of commenting on the unthinkable, Europeans should take action in Greenland'
